Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior: part of tondo decoration within glazed wall; frieze of alternate black and red tongues within a double dot band framed by triple lines; exterior: glazed black below; triple lines above, and band delimiting handle zone.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd possibly belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1965,0930.856. There is no evidence of black figure related incision on the sherd.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 40, pl. 23, no. 42a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0398) (Phase 1)
